title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A classic novel set in the American South during the 1930s, addressing issues of racism and injustice.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel that explores the consequences of totalitarianism and surveillance society.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A story of the Roaring Twenties, decadence, and the American Dream.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A classic romance novel exploring societal norms and relationships in 19th-century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A coming-of-age novel following the adventures of Holden Caulfield in New York City.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy trilogy following the quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.
